answers.answer: I'm not sure what you mean by 'speech without the thoughts'It seems like you are a fairly healthy 61 year old, congratulationsthe findings of small lesions as described on MRI are usually due to high blood pressure, hardening of the arteries, migraine or rarer causes like demyelinating disease, or vascultis. They are realtively common in your age group and are usually asymptomatic. If severe enough they could potentially cause urinary or speech problems (a spastic dysarthria) termed pseudobulbar palsy - I do not know how severe they are in your case without seeing the MRIthere is no indication for aspirin unless you have already ha a stroke or had more stroke risk factors like diabetesGood luck

In my opinion you need to rule out Lyme disease. MRI findings similar to yours are common with neurological Lyme. The other symptoms you describe could also be caused by Lyme disease.Go to http://www.lymenet.org for more info. Click on Flash Discussion and then Medical.Best Wishes

question: I recently had a MRI of my brain looking for causes of occasional uncontrolled urination and speech without the thoughts.  My doctor says everything is okay based on his interpretation of the MRI.  I've never had this problem until three months ago and seem to be getting worst.  I'm 61 years old, 6"1", 180 lbs and in generally good health. I'm not a diabetic, normal blood pressure and pulse, 113LDL/76HDL, borderline anemic and I exercise regularly.  I've been diagnosed with a left bundle branch block in my heart but it hasn't caused me any problems for five years and a heart cauterization indicated my arteries were clear.The following is the report of my MRI:FINDINGS:  MRI of the brain was performed prior to and following IV Magnevist. There is no comparison study of the brain.Diffusion imaging is unremarkable. There is mild white matter signal abnormality with small lesions seen predominantly in the bilateral frontal lobes and seen to a lesser extent more diffusely throughout the supratentorial brain. There is no associated mass effect or pathologic enhancement. The major intracranial flow voids are maintained. The mastoid air cells are clear. There is mild bilateral ethmoid mucosal thickening.IMPRESSION: Mild non-specific white matter signal abnormalities. Given the patient
title: Brain MRI for speech disturbance
